intro: Lacinaria laevigata, commonly known as the smooth lacinaria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are smooth and lance-shaped, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Lacinaria laevigata is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
